Name: Linear Programming
Description: Optimization where the objective function and constraints are linear.
Solvability: Polynomial-time solvable with simplex or interior-point methods.

Name: Integer Programming
Description: Optimization where some or all decision variables are restricted to integers.
Solvability: NP-hard in general; solved with branch-and-bound, branch-and-cut.

Name: Nonlinear Programming
Description: Optimization with a nonlinear objective or constraints.
Solvability: May be non-convex; solved with gradient-based or heuristic methods.
Example: Design optimization of an airplane wing.

Name: Mixed-Integer Linear Programming
Description: Linear programming with some integer variables.

Name: Convex Optimization
Description: Optimization where the objective and feasible set are convex.
Solvability: Globally solvable efficiently using convex optimization algorithms.

Name: Quadratic Programming
Description: Optimization with a quadratic objective and linear constraints.
Solvability: Solvable in polynomial time if convex; NP-hard if non-convex.

Name: Stochastic Programming
Description: Optimization under uncertainty, modeled with random variables.
Solvability: Solved with scenario-based or decomposition methods.
Example: Supply chain design under uncertain demand.

Name: Dynamic Programming
Description: Optimization by breaking the problem into subproblems and solving recursively.
Solvability: Polynomial time for certain structures; exponential in general.
Example: Shortest path in a weighted graph.

Name: Multi-objective Optimization
Description: Optimization with multiple objectives, often conflicting.
Solvability: Pareto front solutions; solved with evolutionary or scalarization methods.
Example: Trade-off between cost and environmental impact.

Name: Combinatorial Optimization
Description: Optimization over discrete structures like graphs, sets, permutations.
Solvability: Often NP-hard; solved with exact or heuristic methods.
